objdescid.origination: William Blake author, inventor, delineator. Thomas Butts wrote this receipt, and Blake signed it.

provenance.name: Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery
provenance.note: Thomas Butts; from the Butts collection; acquired by Ruthven Todd no later than 1942; sold in April 1998 in a catalogue of Marvin Sadik Fine Arts of Scarborough, Maine, April 1998 catalogue no. 1, 8th unnumbered item, illustrated in color (not priced); acquired by John Windle and bequeathed by him to the Huntington Library in May 1998 with funds provided by Robert Essick.

repository.institution: Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery

desc.objtitle:
9 September 1806 Receipt to Thomas Butts, 9 September 1806,
Object 1 (Bentley Receipt 8)

objnote.p: Thomas Butts wrote this receipt, and Blake signed it.

To the left of the text is an embossed revenue stamp depicting a shield bearing the union flag and surrounded by the motto “DIEU ET MON DROIT”. Above the shield is a coronet and on the left and right sides are sprigs of long, narrow leaves. Below the shield is the phrase “TWO PENCE / FOR RECEIPT”.

lg.l: Received of Mr. Butts six Keynes (*Letters*, page 123) reads "Received" as "Receiv'd".
